intro: Peplonia asteria, commonly known as the starflower peplonia, is a flowering plant native to the temperate regions of southern Africa. It is characterized by its small, star-shaped blossoms that range in color from white to pale pink. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 centimeters and features narrow, lance-shaped leaves arranged in a basal rosette. Peplonia asteria thrives in well-drained soil and prefers full sun to partial shade. It is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is a member of the Asteraceae family.
